summary: Spider-Man: Far From Home's Stealth Suit Brings Peter Back to Basics
title: Spider-Man: Far From Home's Stealth Suit Brings Peter Back to Basics
excerpt: In Spider-Man: Far From Home, Peter Parker will wear a stealth suit that forces him to rely more on his powers.
description:
A gift from Nick Fury, Spider-Man’s stealth suit appears in all of the Spider-Man: Far From Home trailers released thus far. The suit is brought in as a way to keep Spider-Man from being recognized in Europe, but strips away most of the tech featured in his original suit, which was designed by Tony Stark.

The “back to basics” stealth suit allows Peter to rely more on his powers, instead of the gadgets provided to him by his original suit. “It’s not actually capable of much – it sort of strips Spider-Man back, and it’s now him relying on his powers,” star Tom Holland told io9 during a set visit. “But it is his ability to act as Spider-Man without the world knowing Spider-Man is there. It’s just an idea he has to keep his identity from his friends, but it’s awesome.”

RELATED:VIDEO: Tony Stark And Peter Parker Have Some Major Similarities

While the stealth suit features a pretty sleek look, its first design was deemed "too cool” for Parker. According to Far From Home executive producer Eric Carroll, the first design was “awesome, like an Iron Man helmet.” Ultimately, both he and the film’s director Jon Watts disapproved of the look, because it didn’t match Peter Parker’s dorky personality.

Carroll said they fixed the design by adding “these cheesy flip-up goggles, like those ‘80s glasses. [Tom Holland] has to operate them manually, there’s no cool mechanism.”

RELATED: Marvel’s Kevin Feige Confirms a Hidden Spider-Man and Hulk Link

The stealth suit was designed based on several different Spider-Man looks from the comics, including Spider-Man Noir and Spider-Man: Big Time. Since the suit was a gift from Nick Fury, the design team also considered what past SHIELD agents have worn.

Opening July 2, director Jon Watts’ Spider-Man: Far From Home stars Tom Holland, Samuel L. Jackson, Zendaya, Cobie Smulders, Jon Favreau, JB Smoove, Jacob Batalon and Martin Starr, with Marisa Tomei and Jake Gyllenhaal.

blog.title: Ana
blog.description: “You’re on your own” - Mike Wazowski.

summary:
So as we all know the spider that bit miles had the same powers that he did. We can see it in the invisibility bit here:
And...
body:
Spiderverse

So as we all know the spider that bit miles had the same powers that he did. We can see it in the invisibility bit here:

And what we can assume the neon blue parts of the spider relate to his venom strike (the electricity thing):

But we also see the spider go through the dimension glitch just like the spider people from other dimensions.

This could be due to the spider coming from a different demention, possibly being also brought earlier in time like Gwen and so it’s going through the glitch as well. However, we also know that the spider was very close to the super collider as it was likely living in that under ground whatever thingy that Miles and uncle Aaron went to. This could mean that the spider had been previously exposed to the molecular quantum mechanics and possibly altering it in some sort of way (idk I’m not a scientist). If this is true rather than the theory that it came from another dimension, then it could mean that when it bit Miles it gave him the ability to safely travel through different demensions and not have his cells decay or glitch. This could happen through atomic transition (quantum leap). Atomic transition is what we know as changing electrons within atoms (our knowledge of it is limited) if Miles is able to do this at will then he could survive in other dimensions safely. This is when I bring up this picture:

This could be implying a sequel to spiderverse or could be hinting at Miles or any of the other spider people (but let’s be honest it would be miles) going into the MCU. If he is able to ‘Quantum leap’ then he would be completely safe to stay there or it could be a way of setting up MCU Miles Morales withMCU Peter Parker acting as a father figure to MCU Miles Morales just as Tony Stark did to him. This allows a sequel to spiderverse as Miles would go back to his universe after creating a bond with mcu Peter Parker who then decides he wants to help MCU Miles whether he is a spider person yet or not. Like in spider-man PS4. I then think that this would lead to a father/son bond as Tony Stark and Peter Parker had and coming around full circle to the quote in the FFH trailer “The world needs its next Iron Man,” which is obviously talking about being a leader and his ability but I also think he’s going to fill this role of parental or even mentor to Miles (very likely leading to a similar scene from endgame in which Miles will be crying over Peter dying because we know how much Marvel enjoyed hurting its fans) (also I’d like to add this mentor position could also be towards Morgan Stark and it would be like a whole tragic full circle thing). Miles’ ability to be safe within any dimension opens up the possibility of him travelling between multiple dimensions in future movies and playing as kind of the multi verses spiderman rather than just this one dimension.

Anyway this is just a theory and don’t take it as fact I just needed to get it off my chest after re-watching Spiderverse.

summary:
The new Ultimate Parker Suit for the MCU Spider-Man is ready! ❤️🕷️💙
After his latest suit gets damaged during a battle, Peter...
body:
The new Ultimate Parker Suit for the MCU Spider-Man is ready! ❤️🕷️💙

After his latest suit gets damaged during a battle, Peter makes a new one along with a couple of two new web-shooters. The webbing under the arms are actually Peter’s web-wings, but due to a calibration mistake, they cannot hide inside the suit, making the edges a little visible. Despite of him trying to fix it, he ended keeping them because Aunt May told him that they looked nice 😂❤️

I may make a little comic explaining this 😉

blog.name: inkbloomsinthedarkestplaces
blog.title: Ink
blog.description: Love and life and love of life are a lifelong dream.

summary: Making progress w/ my story! Here's a lil snippet. Trying to figure out whether I should post it on AO3 or not, from Harley's...
body:
Making progress w/ my story! Here’s a lil snippet. Trying to figure out whether I should post it on AO3 or not, from Harley’s POV

Harley Keener

“Nora, you gotta come eat,” Harley sighed from the doorway, finding the blonde slumped by the window as she’d been from the moment she’d finished throwing her bag onto her bed and called it “settling in.” It’d been hours since lunch; Ava was lounging with May on the couch, watching TV, and Peter was doing homework at the kitchen table while also shooting witty commentary at the screen every few minutes- meanwhile, Nora hadn’t taken a step out of her and Ava’s shared room since they’d gotten here.

“I’m not leaving this room.” She crossed her arms and stubbornly turned her face away, reminding Harley faintly of his little sister- he wondered faintly how she was doing back home. After a note to himself to give Abbie a call, he leaned on the doorway.

“May’s been working hard to help us feel at home, and Peter’s been really nice- you can’t at least make an effort?”

“No.” The force pushed into her voice had him inhaling sharply. She turned around, incredulity painted on her face. “Tony- he’s not-” She struggled a few moments before bursting out, “She’s out there, Harley. She’s out there and she’s scared and he’s not letting us do anything about it, how are you not freaking out right now?”

“For the same reason that you are,” Harley responded coolly. “I want to get her back, and you know that, but we… can’t do anything about it that’ll help. Like- even leaving her alive, even not taking her down fully, that’s- whoever’s controlling her, what if they punish her for that? If she knows who we are and we get in the way and she tries to protect us…” He lifted his shoulders and released a shaky breath, “What do you think they’ll do?”

Nora was silent for a long time, her eyes slits of pale blue and hair falling over her shoulders as she turned away again. She lifted her head with a deep sigh and said, so low that he could barely hear her over the gentle buzz of Queens citizens, “I need to take a walk.”

“Wh-?” She zipped open her backpack and pulled out a hoodie, then quickly went to brush past him into the rest of the apartment, making for the front door. “Nora-”

Ava raised her eyes from the TV as she passed and stood in confusion. “Nora, where are you going?”

“Out.”

The redhead exhaled heavily, going over to snatch an apple from the fruit bowl and toss it to the blonde. Harley did his part as he came through the kitchen, holding out the wallet she’d left in her backpack- he knew she wasn’t going to keep the fruit.

She pocketed her wallet and palmed the apple, turning to May to tell her, “I’ll be back before midnight, promise.”

“Alright, hon. Just be careful,” the older woman said after a moment, brows furrowed in confusion. As soon as Nora shut the door May turned to her nephew. “Peter-”

“Yeah.” Peter, a nice guy whose words stumbled quite a bit and top of his head fell at Harley’s shoulder, stood as well, stacking up his books and sliding them to the side of the table. “I’m gonna head over to Ned’s. Um, it was nice meeting you,” he directed his last words to Ava and Harley, grabbed his coat off the arm of the couch and disappeared into the hallway the same way Nora had.

“Well,” Harley said, his voice falling to the living room awkwardly, “Guess that means I should go make a phone call.”

She’s out there and she’s scared and he’s not letting us do anything about it, how are you not freaking out right now?”

“For the same reason that you are,” Harley responded coolly. “I want to get her back, and you know that, but we… can’t do anything about it that’ll help. Like- even leaving her alive, even not taking her down fully, that’s- whoever’s controlling her, what if they punish her for that? If she knows who we are and we get in the way and she tries to protect us…” He lifted his shoulders and released a shaky breath, “What do you think they’ll do?”

Nora was silent for a long time, her eyes slits of pale blue and hair falling over her shoulders as she turned away again. She lifted her head with a deep sigh and said, so low that he could barely hear her over the gentle buzz of Queens citizens, “I need to take a walk.”

“Wh-?” She zipped open her backpack and pulled out a hoodie, then quickly went to brush past him into the rest of the apartment, making for the front door. “Nora-”

Ava raised her eyes from the TV as she passed and stood in confusion. “Nora, where are you going?”

“Out.”

The redhead exhaled heavily, going over to snatch an apple from the fruit bowl and toss it to the blonde. Harley did his part as he came through the kitchen, holding out the wallet she’d left in her backpack- he knew she wasn’t going to keep the fruit.

She pocketed her wallet and palmed the apple, turning to May to tell her, “I’ll be back before midnight, promise.”

“Alright, hon. Just be careful,” the older woman said after a moment, brows furrowed in confusion. As soon as Nora shut the door May turned to her nephew. “Peter-”

“Yeah.” Peter, a nice guy whose words stumbled quite a bit and top of his head fell at Harley’s shoulder, stood as well, stacking up his books and sliding them to the side of the table. “I’m gonna head over to Ned’s. Um, it was nice meeting you,” he directed his last words to Ava and Harley, grabbed his coat off the arm of the couch and disappeared into the hallway the same way Nora had.

“Well,” Harley said, his voice falling to the living room awkwardly, “Guess that means I should go make a phone call.”

trail.content_raw:
Making progress w/ my story! Here’s a lil snippet. Trying to figure out whether I should post it on AO3 or not, from Harley’s POV

Harley Keener

“Nora, you gotta come eat,” Harley sighed from the doorway, finding the blonde slumped by the window as she’d been from the moment she’d finished throwing her bag onto her bed and called it “settling in.” It’d been hours since lunch; Ava was lounging with May on the couch, watching TV, and Peter was doing homework at the kitchen table while also shooting witty commentary at the screen every few minutes- meanwhile, Nora hadn’t taken a step out of her and Ava’s shared room since they’d gotten here.

“I’m not leaving this room.” She crossed her arms and stubbornly turned her face away, reminding Harley faintly of his little sister- he wondered faintly how she was doing back home. After a note to himself to give Abbie a call, he leaned on the doorway.

“May’s been working hard to help us feel at home, and Peter’s been really nice- you can’t at least make an effort?”

“No.” The force pushed into her voice had him inhaling sharply. She turned around, incredulity painted on her face. “Tony- he’s not-” She struggled a few moments before bursting out, “She’s out there, Harley. She’s out there and she’s scared and he’s not letting us do anything about it, how are you not freaking out right now?”

“For the same reason that you are,” Harley responded coolly. “I want to get her back, and you know that, but we… can’t do anything about it that’ll help. Like- even leaving her alive, even not taking her down fully, that’s- whoever’s controlling her, what if they punish her for that? If she knows who we are and we get in the way and she tries to protect us…” He lifted his shoulders and released a shaky breath, “What do you think they’ll do?”

Nora was silent for a long time, her eyes slits of pale blue and hair falling over her shoulders as she turned away again. She lifted her head with a deep sigh and said, so low that he could barely hear her over the gentle buzz of Queens citizens, “I need to take a walk.”

“Wh-?” She zipped open her backpack and pulled out a hoodie, then quickly went to brush past him into the rest of the apartment, making for the front door. “Nora-”

Ava raised her eyes from the TV as she passed and stood in confusion. “Nora, where are you going?”

“Out.”

The redhead exhaled heavily, going over to snatch an apple from the fruit bowl and toss it to the blonde. Harley did his part as he came through the kitchen, holding out the wallet she’d left in her backpack- he knew she wasn’t going to keep the fruit.

She pocketed her wallet and palmed the apple, turning to May to tell her, “I’ll be back before midnight, promise.”

“Alright, hon. Just be careful,” the older woman said after a moment, brows furrowed in confusion. As soon as Nora shut the door May turned to her nephew. “Peter-”

“Yeah.” Peter, a nice guy whose words stumbled quite a bit and top of his head fell at Harley’s shoulder, stood as well, stacking up his books and sliding them to the side of the table. “I’m gonna head over to Ned’s. Um, it was nice meeting you,” he directed his last words to Ava and Harley, grabbed his coat off the arm of the couch and disappeared into the hallway the same way Nora had.

“Well,” Harley said, his voice falling to the living room awkwardly, “Guess that means I should go make a phone call.”

summary:
Peter visits Tony’s grave sometimes. He goes when he’s got a
problem he doesn’t know how to fix, or if he needs to talk to...
body:
Peter visits Tony’s grave sometimes. He goes when he’s got a problem he doesn’t know how to fix, or if he needs to talk to someone. He goes for advice about MJ or sits there with his homework and asks out loud what the answers are. Peter never tells anyone when he’s going and he always goes alone. Sometimes he stays for five minutes and just stares quietly and there are other times he’s there for an hour. He doesn’t leave flowers because he knows Mr. Stark wouldn’t like that but instead tells him about how he was able to stop some bank robbers and recounts all his stories. He tells him that he’s getting ready to apply to colleges and asks about MIT and if Mr. Stark would give him a reference. He finds out Tony sent in a reference the first week he met Peter.

One day he shows up because he’s having a rough week. He really misses him. He’s crying this time. He tells Mr. Stark he’s not mad that he’s gone but that he wishes he could have stayed. He thanks Mr. Stark for bringing him back and that he’s glad he got another shot at all this. He tells him he’ll keep doing this for as long as he can, just to make him proud.

“He is proud.”

Peter looks up and sees Happy standing behind him. He watches Happy come over and tries to wipe his face, tries to make it look like he wasn’t actually crying.

Happy knows.

He walks up next to Peter and tells him that Tony is proud. He tells him that Tony had a picture of him and Peter standing together in his cabin. He tells Peter Tony left instructions for making sure Peter was taken care of ‘just in case’ and that he knew Peter would save the world someday.

Happy pulls out a cheeseburger and puts it on the ground in front of the stone quietly and knows that Peter knows. He knows Peter remembers every time he eats one himself and always thinks of Tony.

“Let’s go, kid.” He says it kindly, putting a hand on his shoulder as they walk to the car.

You made me proud, kid. You’re gonna be better than I ever was, just watch.

blog.name: vandersummer

blog.description:
You can call me Van. She/her. Pisces. INFP. Slytherin. Wannabe writer.
As you can see, RDJ/Tony Stark (They're the same person anyway) owns my fucking heart and soul. Multi fandom blog including Marvel, Harry Potter, Choices: Stories you play and others I may have forgotten about. But especially Marvel. You can send me fic requests if you want. Feel free to DM me about random stuff or just rant.
